00125 #define TEST_SUCCESS "\t[PASS]\n"
00126 #define TEST_FAIL    "\t[FAIL]\n"

00131 static const Union32 PATTERN_MULTIPLE_SECTOR = {0xDEADBEEF};
00132 
00135 static U32 at45dbx_example_error_cnt;

00140 static void at45dbx_example_check_mem(void)
00141 {
00142   if (at45dbx_mem_check() == OK)
00143   {
00144     print_dbg("\tSize:\t");
00145     print_dbg_ulong(AT45DBX_MEM_CNT << (AT45DBX_MEM_SIZE - 20));
00146     print_dbg(" MB\t" TEST_SUCCESS);
00147   }
00148   else
00149   {
00150     print_dbg(TEST_FAIL);
00151   }
00152 }

00157 static void at45dbx_example_test_byte_mem(void)
00158 {
00159   U8 Pattern = 0x55;
00160   U8 j = 0xA5;
00161   print_dbg("\tUsing Pattern 0x55");
00162   // Perform write access.
00163   if (at45dbx_write_open(Pattern) == OK)
00164   {
00165     at45dbx_write_byte(Pattern);
00166     at45dbx_write_close();
00167   }
00168   // Perform read access.
00169   if (at45dbx_read_open(Pattern) == OK)
00170   {
00171     j = at45dbx_read_byte();
00172     at45dbx_read_close();
00173   }
00174   // Check read and write operations.
00175   if (j == Pattern)
00176   {
00177     print_dbg(TEST_SUCCESS);
00178   }
00179   else
00180   {
00181     print_dbg(TEST_FAIL);
00182   }
00183 
00184   // Change the pattern used.
00185   Pattern = 0xAA;
00186   j = 0xA5;
00187   print_dbg("\tUsing Pattern 0xAA");
00188   // Perform write access.
00189   if (at45dbx_write_open(Pattern) == OK)
00190   {
00191     at45dbx_write_byte(Pattern);
00192     at45dbx_write_close();
00193   }
00194   // Perform read access.
00195   if (at45dbx_read_open(Pattern) == OK)
00196   {
00197     j = at45dbx_read_byte();
00198     at45dbx_read_close();
00199   }
00200   // Check read and write operations.
00201   if (j == Pattern)
00202   {
00203     print_dbg(TEST_SUCCESS);
00204   }
00205   else
00206   {
00207     print_dbg(TEST_FAIL);
00208   }
00209 }

00214 static void at45dbx_example_test_RAM_mem(void)
00215 {
00216   static U8 PatternTable[AT45DBX_SECTOR_SIZE];
00217   static U8 ReceiveTable[AT45DBX_SECTOR_SIZE];
00218 
00219   U8 Pattern = 0x55;
00220   memset(PatternTable, Pattern, AT45DBX_SECTOR_SIZE);
00221   memset(ReceiveTable, 0xA5, AT45DBX_SECTOR_SIZE);
00222   print_dbg("\tUsing Pattern 0x55");
00223   // Perform write access.
00224   if (at45dbx_write_open(Pattern) == OK)
00225   {
00226     at45dbx_write_sector_from_ram(PatternTable);
00227     at45dbx_write_close();
00228   }
00229   // Perform read access.
00230   if (at45dbx_read_open(Pattern) == OK)
00231   {
00232     at45dbx_read_sector_2_ram(ReceiveTable);
00233     at45dbx_read_close();
00234   }
00235   // Check read and write operations.
00236   if (!memcmp(ReceiveTable, PatternTable, AT45DBX_SECTOR_SIZE))
00237   {
00238     print_dbg(TEST_SUCCESS);
00239   }
00240   else
00241   {
00242     print_dbg(TEST_FAIL);
00243   }
00244 
00245   // Change the pattern used.
00246   Pattern = 0xAA;
00247   memset(PatternTable, Pattern, AT45DBX_SECTOR_SIZE);
00248   memset(ReceiveTable, 0xA5, AT45DBX_SECTOR_SIZE);
00249   print_dbg("\tUsing Pattern 0xAA");
00250   // Perform write access.
00251   if (at45dbx_write_open(Pattern) == OK)
00252   {
00253     at45dbx_write_sector_from_ram(PatternTable);
00254     at45dbx_write_close();
00255   }
00256   // Perform read access.
00257   if (at45dbx_read_open(Pattern) == OK)
00258   {
00259     at45dbx_read_sector_2_ram(ReceiveTable);
00260     at45dbx_read_close();
00261   }
00262   // Check read and write operations.
00263   if (!memcmp(ReceiveTable, PatternTable, AT45DBX_SECTOR_SIZE))
00264   {
00265     print_dbg(TEST_SUCCESS);
00266   }
00267   else
00268   {
00269     print_dbg(TEST_FAIL);
00270   }
00271 }

00273 
00276 static void at45dbx_example_test_multiple_sector(void)
00277 {
00278   U32 position = 252;
00279   U32 nb_sector = 4;
00280 
00281   // Initialize counters.
00282   at45dbx_example_error_cnt = 0;
00283 
00284   // Write sectors.
00285   print_dbg("\tWriting sectors\n");
00286   at45dbx_write_open(position);
00287   at45dbx_write_multiple_sector(nb_sector);
00288   at45dbx_write_close();
00289 
00290   // Read written sectors.
00291   print_dbg("\tReading sectors\t");
00292   at45dbx_read_open(position);
00293   at45dbx_read_multiple_sector(nb_sector);
00294   at45dbx_read_close();
00295 
00296   if (!at45dbx_example_error_cnt)
00297   {
00298     print_dbg(TEST_SUCCESS);
00299   }
00300   else
00301   {
00302     print_dbg(TEST_FAIL "\t");
00303     print_dbg_ulong(at45dbx_example_error_cnt);
00304     print_dbg(" errors\n");
00305   }
00306 }
00307 
00308 
00309 void at45dbx_write_multiple_sector_callback(void *psector)
00310 {
00311   U32 *pdata = psector;
00312   psector = (U8 *)psector + AT45DBX_SECTOR_SIZE;
00313   while ((void *)pdata < psector) *pdata++ = PATTERN_MULTIPLE_SECTOR.u32;
00314 }
00315 
00316 
00317 void at45dbx_read_multiple_sector_callback(const void *psector)
00318 {
00319   const Union32 *pdata = psector;
00320   psector = (const U8 *)psector + AT45DBX_SECTOR_SIZE;
00321   while ((const void *)pdata < psector)
00322   {
00323     if (pdata->u32 != PATTERN_MULTIPLE_SECTOR.u32)
00324     {
00325       at45dbx_example_error_cnt += (pdata->u8[0] != PATTERN_MULTIPLE_SECTOR.u8[0]) +
00326                                    (pdata->u8[1] != PATTERN_MULTIPLE_SECTOR.u8[1]) +
00327                                    (pdata->u8[2] != PATTERN_MULTIPLE_SECTOR.u8[2]) +
00328                                    (pdata->u8[3] != PATTERN_MULTIPLE_SECTOR.u8[3]);
00329     }
00330     pdata++;
00331   }
00332 }

00334 
00337 static void at45dbx_resources_init(void)
00338 {
00339   static const gpio_map_t AT45DBX_SPI_GPIO_MAP =
00340   {
00341     {AT45DBX_SPI_SCK_PIN,          AT45DBX_SPI_SCK_FUNCTION         },  // SPI Clock.
00342     {AT45DBX_SPI_MISO_PIN,         AT45DBX_SPI_MISO_FUNCTION        },  // MISO.
00343     {AT45DBX_SPI_MOSI_PIN,         AT45DBX_SPI_MOSI_FUNCTION        },  // MOSI.
00344 #define AT45DBX_ENABLE_NPCS_PIN(NPCS, unused) \
00345     {AT45DBX_SPI_NPCS##NPCS##_PIN, AT45DBX_SPI_NPCS##NPCS##_FUNCTION},  // Chip Select NPCS.
00346     MREPEAT(AT45DBX_MEM_CNT, AT45DBX_ENABLE_NPCS_PIN, ~)
00347 #undef AT45DBX_ENABLE_NPCS_PIN
00348   };
00349 
00350   // SPI options.
00351   spi_options_t spiOptions =
00352   {
00353     .reg          = 0,
00354     .baudrate     = AT45DBX_SPI_MASTER_SPEED, // Defined in conf_at45dbx.h.
00355     .bits         = AT45DBX_SPI_BITS,         // Defined in conf_at45dbx.h.
00356     .spck_delay   = 0,
00357     .trans_delay  = 0,
00358     .stay_act     = 1,
00359     .spi_mode     = 0,
00360     .fdiv         = 0,
00361     .modfdis      = 1
00362   };
00363 
00364   // Assign I/Os to SPI.
00365   gpio_enable_module(AT45DBX_SPI_GPIO_MAP,
00366                      sizeof(AT45DBX_SPI_GPIO_MAP) / sizeof(AT45DBX_SPI_GPIO_MAP[0]));
00367 
00368   // Initialize as master.
00369   spi_initMaster(AT45DBX_SPI, &spiOptions);
00370 
00371   // Set selection mode: variable_ps, pcs_decode, delay.
00372   spi_selectionMode(AT45DBX_SPI, 0, 0, 0);
00373 
00374   // Enable SPI.
00375   spi_enable(AT45DBX_SPI);
00376 
00377   // Initialize data flash with SPI clock Osc0.
00378   at45dbx_init(spiOptions, FOSC0);
00379 }
00380 
00381 
00384 int main(void)
00385 {
00386   // Switch to external oscillator 0.
00387   pm_switch_to_osc0(&AVR32_PM, FOSC0, OSC0_STARTUP);
00388 
00389   // Initialize RS232 debug text output.
00390   init_dbg_rs232(FOSC0);
00391   print_dbg(MSG_WELCOME);
00392 
00393   // Initialize AT45DBX resources: GPIO, SPI and AT45DBX.
00394   at45dbx_resources_init();
00395 
00396   // Perform a memory check on all DFs.
00397   print_dbg("Entering Memory Check:\n");
00398   at45dbx_example_check_mem();
00399 
00400   // Test single-byte access functions.
00401   print_dbg("Entering Memory Test (Byte Access):\n");
00402   at45dbx_example_test_byte_mem();
00403 
00404   // Test single-sector access functions.
00405   print_dbg("Entering Memory Test (RAM Access):\n");
00406   at45dbx_example_test_RAM_mem();
00407 
00408   // Test multiple-sector access functions.
00409   print_dbg("Entering Multiple Sector Test:\n");
00410   at45dbx_example_test_multiple_sector();
00411 
00412   while (TRUE);
00413 }
